COISS images of Enceladus at high north-based emission angle

COISS images of Enceladus at high phase angle and high north-based emission angle. This should give null result because the former requires looking down on the pole and the latter requires being near the equator.
COISS images with Observation Name containing 046RI_RDHRESSCN. This number should always stay the same.
Most of the 046RI_RDHRESSCN images are better than this resolution
Not coincidentally, that same number are NAC images
Completing the set, the same number have poor resolution
